data.value: Generates a probability plot of sample data against the quantiles of a specified theoretical distribution (the normal distribution by default).
optionally calculates a best-fit line for the data and plots the results using Matplotlib or a given plot function.
is given, the figure is not shown or saved by
generates a probability plot, which should not be confused with a Q-Q or a P-P plot.  Statsmodels has more extensive functionality of this type, see
The formula used for the theoretical quantiles (horizontal axis of the probability plot) is Filliben's estimate:

quantiles = dist.ppf(val), for

        0.5**(1/n),                  for i = n
  val = (i - 0.3175) / (n + 0.365),  for i = 2, ..., n-1
        1 - 0.5**(1/n),              for i = 1
indicates the i-th ordered value and
is the total number of values.
Distribution-specific shape parameters (shape parameters plus location and scale).

Fit a least-squares regression (best-fit) line to the sample data if True (default).
If given, plots the quantiles. If given and
is True, also plots the least squares fit.
is an object that has to have methods "plot" and "text". The
module or a Matplotlib Axes object can be used, or a custom object with the same methods. Default is None, which means that no plot is created.
to True includes the coefficient of determination on the plot. Default is False.
